reviewText: One of the most well known outdoor concert amphitheatres is the beautiful Red Rocks, Colorado, located at the foothills close to Denver.  Done in conjunction withRocky Mountain Homecoming, the Red Rocks Homecoming features the voices of gospels beloved and favorites.  Interspersed are shots of beautiful mountain views, sunsets, and tourist sites.Ivan Parker opens with "Then He Said, "Sing!"  and comedy with Mark Lowry is enjoyed as the Gaither Vocal Band (David, Guy, Bill and Russ)  sing the old Gene Autrey cowboy classic, "Ridin' Down the Canyon."  A few highlights are, Lynda Randle singing "A Perfect Heart";  Donnie Sumner passionately sings "The Anchor Holds"  and "They Call it Gospel Music" with Russ Taff.Among the groups performing  are the Greenes, "One More Mountain;  "Mention My Name" with the Hoppers;  "The Reason That I'm Standing"  featuring the Crabb Family.  A tribute song by Legacy Five  "Heroes of the Faith" is about some of the adored gospel heroes who have gone home.  And the Speer Family sing "I Never Shall Forget The Day".In addition, two comedians share the stage; Aaron Wilburn has fun with aging.  Wilburn played in the Happy Goodman's band.  You can see him comment on a classic DVD concertThe Happy Goodman Family: Live in Texas.  Comedian Taylor Mason performs with his pink puppet pig.Other songs include:For I'm Persuaded To Believe -  Mark LowryBigger Than Any Mountain - Stephen Hill, Ann Downing, Amy LambertI've Never Loved Him Better Than Today - Mike Allen, Jake Hess, Wesley Pritchard, Reggie SmithThere Shall Be Showers Of Blessing - Sue Dodge, Ben SpeerI'm Rich - Jessy Dixon, Stephen HillThanks - Joy Gardner, Lillie KnaulsSo High - featuring Terry BlackwoodWhen The Rains Come - Johnny Minick, Joyce McCollough, Jonathan Martin, Joy Gardner, Ivan Parker, Ladye Love Smith, Sonya IsaacsIt Is Finished - the Gaither Vocal BandWonderful music, beautiful Colorado mountain setting.....Rizzo
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is one of our favorite dvd,s of the Gaithers. The scenery is just gorgeous and the performers are wonderful. If you love gospel music,you will sure enjoy this video. Bill Gaither is the best in choosing his locations and performers. I have about 50 of his dvd,s and I keep on ordering more. I can,t get enough of this group of singers. Bill always has something new going on. The seller is awesome,great packaging and fast delivery.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Red Rocks ampitheater in Colorado is perhaps the most unusual and beautiful setting in which to see and hear music.  The Gaither musicians did a great job singing ans playing Gospel music.  a treat for the eyes and ears,  I received the DVD in a timely manner, and it is of excellent quality.

reviewText: THIS IS A GREAT DVD. I REALLY LIKE THE GAITHER VOCAL BAND. THE DVD HAS A LOT OF GREAT MUSIC IF YOU LIKE SOUTHERN GOSPEL.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I bought this some time after I purchased Rocky Mountain Homecoming. This is a good DVD too, though not quite as lovely as RMH. There is one song in particular that moved me. It is toward the end and is by Donnie Sumner.  The song is, The Anchor Holds.  I loved it. A fantastic rendition. This DVD is well worth the money, and though it does not come together quite as well as some, it has all those beautiful people in it.  Can't beat that!Mickey Thorne
